3jwgEYMSmGYU4pRNDyK3Q.title: How to find the backup file to restore Pure

fields.title: How to connect Mudita devices to Mudita Center

content.value: Open Mudita Center on your computer
Insert the USB-C end of the cable into your device
Insert the USB cable into your computer’s USB slot
You may need to enter your device passcode to complete the connection
You will see the file path (Example: C:\Users\Documents\Mudita)
Follow the file path using your computer’s browser
*The backup tab opens by default, if it does not, click Backup at the top of the screen

externalLinks.title: Managing Mudita Pure Data Backups in Mudita Center

2LdxNPs7SgMxzx7qNOTbGd.title: How to import contacts from CSV file or Vcard

fields.title: How to connect Mudita devices to Mudita Center

content.value: Open Mudita Center on your computer
Insert the USB-C end of the cable into your device
Insert the USB cable into your computer’s USB slot
You may need to enter your device passcode to complete the connection
Select the CSV or vCard file from your computer
Select the individual contacts to import or select
* Important - do not disconnect your phone while the import is in progress

GDXY0j8KpAPz4ERgrgWOb.title: Device won’t connect to Mudita Center

content.value: There are a few things you can try if your device does not connect to Mudita Center:
Plug the USB cable into a different USB slot
Unplug the cable and check both the cable and slot for dirt or damage
Make sure the USB plug goes all the way into the slot
Unlock the screen of your device (if applicable)
If none of the above fix the problem,

externalLinks.title: Connecting a Mudita Pure or Harmony to Mudita Center

Inspect the USB port and cable for damage or dirt

Try using a different USB-C cable

3fY8uvgep1Qo9E8DdzYekI.title: Forgotten passcode for Pure

content.value: To reset your passcode you must do a

fields.title: How to do factory reset on Pure

content.value: Turn off your Pure, hold down the right selection key > select Yes
Press the central key to confirm*
Hold down both the right selection key and the central key
Press 2 on the number pad to select factory reset when the bootloader menu appears
Wait for Pure to turn off
Turn on your Pure, hold down the right selection key
Follow the setup process and choose a new passcode when prompted
*You can also remove and replace the battery to turn it off
Make sure your phone is disconnected from your computer
Go to Factory Reset > select Factory Reset
Turn on Pure, hold down the right selection key
Follow the setup process and choose a new passcode when prompted

fields.warningMessage: This will delete everything on your phone! Recommended to create a backup first. Your MuditaOS version will stay the same.

3fY8uvgep1Qo9E8DdzYekI.warningMessage: This will delete everything on your phone! Your MuditaOS version will stay the same.

externalLinks.title: Can I Lock the Phone With a PIN or Password?

4OYcam2NvOha877tX5yNRy.title: An OS (Operating System) update fails on Pure

content.value: There are some things you can try if an update fails:
Disconnect your device from the computer
Enter the passcode to unlock the screen for Pure
Try connecting to a different USB port
Try updating using a different computer if available
A factory reset removes all user files - backup your data before trying this step
If none of the above fix the problem,

externalLinks.title: Mudita OS Update Failed?

4IGKLX5uJFPVlWnijubrOA.title: How to restore Pure from backup

fields.title: How to connect Mudita devices to Mudita Center

content.value: Open Mudita Center on your computer
Insert the USB-C end of the cable into your device
Insert the USB cable into your computer’s USB slot
You may need to enter your device passcode to complete the connection
Select the Backup you want to restore from the list

4IGKLX5uJFPVlWnijubrOA.warningMessage: There is no way to recover or change the password for backups

externalLinks.title: Managing Mudita Pure Data Backups in Mudita Center

6vwtehnv7gfUKgf2xyg3sc.title: Sending device logs to customer support

fields.title: How to connect Mudita devices to Mudita Center

content.value: Open Mudita Center on your computer
Insert the USB-C end of the cable into your device
Insert the USB cable into your computer’s USB slot
You may need to enter your device passcode to complete the connection
In the new window enter your email address and describe the issue your device has in as much detail as possible
The device logs will attach automatically as a ZIP. file
We try to reply within 48 hours, but it can take longer if a ticket is opened over the weekend or if we are dealing with a lot of requests.
* Always connect the device that is experiencing the problem

736yNkrCPAClGCHGXkJs7p.title: How to do factory reset on Pure

content.value: Turn off your Pure, hold down the right selection key > select Yes
Press the central key to confirm*
Hold down both the right selection key and the central key
Press 2 on the number pad to select factory reset when the bootloader menu appears
Wait for Pure to turn off
Turn on your Pure, hold down the right selection key
Follow the setup process and choose a new passcode when prompted
*You can also remove and replace the battery to turn it off
Make sure your phone is disconnected from your computer
Go to Factory Reset > select Factory Reset
Turn on Pure, hold down the right selection key
Follow the setup process and choose a new passcode when prompted

736yNkrCPAClGCHGXkJs7p.warningMessage: This will delete everything on your phone! Recommended to create a backup first. Your MuditaOS version will stay the same.

6dTkIwEyyzbLo4tU4sO6hR.title: Harmony won’t turn on after a factory reset (Harmony in transport mode)

content.value: After a factory reset, or occasionally when you first receive your Harmony, it will be in Transport mode.
Make sure your device is charging from a suitable power outlet
If this does not fix the problem,
*If you do not click the light button, the device will enter Transport mode again automatically
